Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Gate opening and selective gate opening for C2H2

Other Information.Additional Info: C2H2 uptake capacity is 81.0 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Gate opening pressure much higher for CO2 than C2H2

Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 uptake capacity is only 5.4 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to smaller pore aperture

Other Information.Additional Info: C2H4 uptake capacity is only 5.3 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to smaller pore aperture

Other Information.Additional Info: C2H6 uptake capacity is only 1.0 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to smaller pore aperture

Other Information.Additional Info: CH4 uptake capacity is only 1.1 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to smaller pore aperture

Other Information.Additional Info: N2 uptake capacity is only 1.1 cm³/g at 1 bar and 298 K.

Sieving Mechanism: Selective gate opening for C2H2 adsorption over other C1 and C2 gases under ambient temperature.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, GCMC simulation, DFT calculations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C2H2/CO2 uptake ratio: 14.9, Dynamic separation selectivity: 5.7

Other Information.Additional Info: ZNU-3 exhibits flexible molecular sieving behavior due to mobile hydrogen bonds which allow selective gate opening for acetylene over other gases.
